title: No Timer Switch Function?!
text:
I converted my entire home to the system. Over 40 switches. There are lots of things that are cool like schedules and being able to converge multiple lights into a single switch… Creating switches where no wires exist, and so on. 

BUT THERE ARE NO TIMERS! There are so many rooms that you need light for only a few minutes (pantry, laundry room, or a garage)… Lights that constantly get left on and that people often forget to turn off. You have schedules, but why no timers??? The system knows how many and which lights are on at all times, how simple would it be to program the server that if it sees the pantry light on to turn it off in a designated amount of time (5, 10, or 20 minutes). 

Lord knows the switches are expensive enough, you would think that you could set it up as a timed switch, but you can’t… Not yet. And it wouldn’t require a different switch, just a feature in the app itself.

title: Rock solid
text:
We have over 90 devices - on two bridges. The two accounts that are required are a bit of a hassle, Home brings them together - and this is what we use. After three years of service, the system has been running rock solid and dependable. The system deals perfectly with the many lightning related power outages we have in Texas. 

I am super excited about the new fan controllers and will replace my eight fans that are on the old on/off switch today. Thank you for the 75 device expansion, not enough, though. A really nice feature would be the merger of the RA Select and Caseta lines for more flexibility. I do not believe it would eat into revenue as both lines serve completely different markets. But it would allow tinkerer to spend more money that they otherwise would not spend. 

An in-wall outlet is missing from the line, the plug-in model is no replacement. I am running a couple of Z-wave outlets today for these for various things such as pump controller, outside lighting, and holiday illumination. Z-wave has been running fairly stable, but compared to Clear Connect, no comparison. Z-wave so and so often fails to trigger, whereas Clear Connect works every single time.

title: Siri phone works. Watch does not at first
text:
Alexa will work but not as well as Siri. But Siri only works well with the iPhone. The watch does download the app but does not let you control anything. I had to delete My Home in HomeKit and reload the bridges to get it working. That is crazy. Also, the app watch does not let you access devices. It only lets you access scenes. So unless you create a scene you will not see your device. So create a scene to turn on a light and create a 2nd scene to turn off the light. Not very smart. 

With all that said, I don’t think there is a better hardware device for switches. Add Hue Lights to Caseta and you have an amazing system. 

The 30ft Range is not a problem for me yet but at a minimum they should create a mesh of Bridges that could add 50 devices each. So that with 3 Bridges one could handle 150 devices. 2 Bridges with 2 separate accounts is not an acceptable solution. And the expensive custom “RA2” which is a premium to the “Caseta” system is not HomeKit ready which means that even for free no one would want that outdated expensive system.  Currently you can only do 50 switches on Caseta, which means you have to be selective on what to use Caseta. May be light switches using Caseta and use a different Brand to control power plugs.

title: Use Application Without An Online Account
text:
Update**
Is someone going to respond/look into this??

I simply want to use this application without any online account. I am able to do this to an existent by configuring using the contractor mode and setting the IP of my hub manually. However, this setup timesout after a period of a few days.. The capability exists so why not make it a first class experience? There are many users who have no interest in using this application over the internet or creating an account online [for security reasons]. Outside of the occasional firmware update [which ideally I should be able to control when and how that occurs]. I don’t want critical infrastructure in my home talking to or being accessed from anything on the internet. In these days and times companies that take privacy and security seriously will continue to grow and thrive - those that do not adapt and address these issue, ultimately will loose market share to those that do. Quite a shame because Lutron has a very solid product; they just need to remove friction for the privacy and security minded.

title: Simply. Awesome.
text:
The possibilities with this system are endless and I have a lot of different scenes set up and automatic scenes set as well.  The right lighting levels in your home make all the difference in the world, and I have dimmers set that ensure my plant lights with plant lights around the house receive adequate lighting while I'm at work.  

I never have any issues with the app and I can easily adjust lighting from my iPhone, iPads, even my Apple Watch in a pinch. And I have a few wireless remotes in the remote cradles and remotes mounted on walls with regular switch plates that work just light regular dimming light switches.  I also have the hub which is key and it integrates with Apple HomeKit so you can let Siri adjust things for you too. 

When friends and family come over they're seriously blown away - it's professional-grade. It's not exactly cheap, but I'm not looking for cheap - I want something that works flawlessly and that doesn't cost an arm and a leg either.  

Switching lighting scenes couldn't be simpler.  Combine that with auto shade adjustments and even temperature control and jaws drop.  For me it's the ultimate convenience that I love, and being able to achieve the perfect lighting levels for every occasion.  

I can't imagine going back to the days of constantly having to flip switches on and off around the house.  I've tried others and this is by far the BEST.  I love this system. I'd never go back - Look no further.

title: No support for multiple homes/locations
text: The app is good and the wireless dimmers are great, I liked them so much that I added them to our vacation home.  To my surprise the app does not support multiple homes! Wow! I had other wireless switches in our second home which worked perfectly while being controlled by Google home and more importantly by voice commands as Google home DOES support multiple homes.  I switched to Lutron in order to have only one system and now I basically have lost my voice command ability as you can not set up multiple homes in Google home since you would have to set up two Lutron accounts and link them to Google home in order to accomplish it. Google home/Lutron does not allow for this.  So now I have lost my voice controls.  The app needs still needs to mature a lot.  Need to add multiple location support!!

title: Loading time
text:
Takes a long time to load but otherwise works great. I like that you can set lights to turn off at a certain time in case you forget to turn them off. I also have my outside light set to turn on from sunset to sunrise. Works well with Alexa and customer service was awesome when I had some setup questions with the dimmers. Just wish the app would start up faster.

Update: loads a bit faster now but still not fast enough. I figured out got to add the today widget which is much faster to use. I recommend using that for the lights you use the most instead of opening the app.

Feature request: would love more flexibility in the schedule area, for one time needs (not repeating) such as: leave light on for the night (turn off at sunrise) and a timer like turn lights off in 3 hours. Thanks!

title: Still no timer programming feature
text: As I said in my previous review this app would be off the charts if it allowed the user to set up timer programming for any Lutron Caseta switch. Example: say you had an exhaust fan in the bathroom and you wanted to turn it on and have it stay on for a predetermined time. That’s where this would come in handy because you could program the switch so that if it is turned on manually, through the app, or even by Siri the switch would stay on until the programmed timer has run its course. The feature could be programmed in the app and operate similar to a schedule. The timer program feature would allow you to set the time in increments(5,10,15,20,25,30,.......60minutes).

title: Not as good as it used to be.
text:
I have most of my Caseta controlled lights on a schedule which not only turns on and off the lights at specific times but I also control the brightness of the lights depending on the time. And I liked the fact that I could override a given schedule by pressing another schedule item on the schedule list.

But it looks like with the recent updates to the Caseta app, this is no longer possible. When I called customer service to complain about this issue, I was told that the feature was removed on purpose by the developers of the app! Now why on earth would a useful feature like that be removed for no apparent reason????

Please bring this feature back. Pretty please!!!

title: Best home automation we have
text: We’ve had Caséta fo about 3 years now.  We have two systems in two buildings.   This has been the most connected (to other companies systems) and most reliable home automation for us (also have nest, Honeywell, August/Yale, Liftmaster, and Orbit and some others that got thrown out).  It has worked when the others won’t (network issues).  Siri can be a bad at times with our other devices but it always manages to work with the lights.  Liftmaster is close but we’ve only had it for half a year.  I’m happy we got Caséta and will continue to build our system. My only wish for the app is that I could support both buildings in the app at the same time - HomeKit fills this gap though.

title: Problem Resolved- Watch App Missing Pro Dimmer Light
text:
Update: Lutron’s suggested remedy was successful. For some reason the Pro Dimmer needed to be selected in the Apple Watch settings for it to be visible on the watch menu. Curiously the other 11 Dimmers in my house were automatically selected to appear on the watch menu. Easy fix. Five Star product!

The Lutron Caseta iPhone App works well but the Apple Watch App is missing one of my Wall Dimmers. It is the only Pro Dimmer in my home and is wired as a 3 way switch. I am using a Pro controller. HomeKit successfully shows the Pro Dimmer on it’s app on my Apple Watch. So why doesn’t the Pro Dimmer appear on Lutrons own app for the Apple Watch?

title: New update is more user friendly
text: This app has potential. Still mixed whether I prefer home kit interface vs this app. The colors and layout are visually pleasing and they have continually improved in that area. The nice thing is their app hasn’t been to buggy with prior versions. I wish wish wish there was more customization. In specific for my theater Room I used to have a previous maestro switch that you could dim over 15 seconds for a subtle light change that was perfect. Now with the Caseta dimmer there is no options despite it being a smart dimmer. It takes about 5 seconds. Had to go with Caseta because I switched to LED bulbs. Would love to see them build that into the app. Thanks for your guys work on this.

title: Adequate
text: The app makes the process of adding devices simple enough. But I wish the scenes could have conditions. For example, I have a “night light” scene that dimly lights my way to the bathroom and kitchen at night when I don’t want bright light to make me too alert. But what if someone else is in one of the rooms in my path? If the lights are already on, I don’t want to dim them. So I’d like to say, if this light is off, set it to 10%. But maybe that’s a HomeKit failing. Line is kind of blurry. Also, there appears to be no good way for a Pico to trigger a non-Lutron device, except in HomeKit if it’s grouped with a Lutron dimmer. If the would allow the app to see non Luton HomeKit devices, we could map them to a Pico’s buttons, which would be nice for things like controlling a fan or a HomeKit light.

title: Still loving it. . . .
text: We have 4 homes. I started in our vacation home in the Hudson Valley and went crazy.   Next it started with 1 switch in Palm Beach and . . .  Again. . . Within a month every switch in the house. We just remodeled a home and changed to all black k units that look great and the long awaited support for multiple homes is awesome.   I’d like to be able to arrange the app rooms in something more logical than alphabetical order . . . But, it works and it’s stable and rock solid reliable. I have had 2 bad switches and a fellow a Home Depot told me I wasn’t familiar with them. I’ve installed over 150 and had a pretty fair sense these 2 were defective. No biggie. I love the system.

title: Now has iPad formatted version and but still lacking some cool features
text: This is an updated review. They recent added iPad formatted version and added rooms.  The app works on both iPhone and iPad and is good. There are some features that are not include that are available in the Smart Bridge such as delay and fade rates. If I use a 3rd party app I can include those two features in scenes and then I can select those scenes in the Lutron app and they work so I’m assuming they are stored in the hub. Not sure if other features are missing that I’m not aware of. What is interesting is that HomeKit/Siri scenes are different than Lutron scenes and done use the scenes stored in the hub. Alexa uses the Lutron scenes. It is nice that developers responded to my initial review. Thanks Lutron!

title: Google Assistant Sync Bug
text:
Seems when you link the Lutron Caseta to Google Assistant, it takes both the device and room as its device name. For ie: I have a device called kitchen and set the room as kitchen. When you link it to Google Assistant, it shows the device name as Kitchen Kitchen, so now when I ask Google home to turn on Kitchen, it goes, “ok, turning on kitchen kitchen”. It had imported fine when I first got Google Assistant installed, but now has this weird bug.

Also while in the Lutron app, it freezes and lags when switching between menus. Now it has taken what I call Master Bedroom and added a room called Bedroom Bedroom because of the Google Assistant sync.

title: Great app, but one suggestion!!
text:
I have Lutron all over my house, and it’s a great service. I often get migraines so having an app that can switch off all my lights when I need to be in the dark is very convenient, not to mention the general convenience of not needing to get up. Lutron is a solid system and doesn’t disappoint. 

My one suggestion is rooted in with my migraine issue. I would love to see a dark mode on the app. The white box I see when opening the app is blinding almost and can worsen my headaches to another degree. If there was a dark mode that would be awesome. Developers, are you able to add this feature? If so, any timeline? Thanks!!

title: Very good.. but needs a few key features...
text:
Intuitive layout and connects quickly. Would like to see a few more things:

1. Be able to turn on/off all lights in a room with one button press (maybe embed controls into the room name line?)

2. Be able to arbitrarily group lights for control. Some default groups would be room (already have this) and floor. Each room is added to a floor.

3. *new* move the enable slider on schedules outside of the edit/pencil menu so it’s immediately clear which schedules are in effect. The filled in schedule icons indicating which one is currently “on” is unintuitive. It should not be a control. I don’t want to invoke a schedule manually. I would use a scene for that. I’m not sure if you can schedule scenes but you should be able to. I also think that schedules should be able to include both an on and off time rather than needing 2 schedules to accomplish this (since they are managed independently, it’s easy to enable one and forget to enable the other).

title: Actually worth it
text: I have several home lighting control systems and Lutron is by far the best.  After more than a month of use The lights are always ready to access in the home section. I have apps from Philips and TCP for controlling lights and it seems the lights are always in “updating” mode and take 10 seconds and dozens of taps to get them ready to turn on. Additionally I like the ability to set timers based on sunrise and sunset (which makes sense from a lighting perspective). The caseta system is well worth it and will use this in the future unless I really want a color-changing light. Philips Hue is a distant 2nd option.

title: Terrible UI practically unusable
text: This is a huge step backwards in usability. In the old version, all the scenes and devices I use most were immediately available for one-handed operation when the app is first opened. That functionality is now gone, replaced by a weird  mess of scrolling tabbed panels that you have to dig through to find things. Scenes take several extra taps to even get to. Making matters worse, everything is organized alphabetically in these panels, a decision which makes no sense whatseover. I much preferred the dark appearance option, particularly in a dark room. Removal of the icon choices also hampers uasbility. Now, you have to look at every item name when navigating instead of quickly glancing at the app. Horrible choices all around. I can't find one thing this version actually improved to make the app more usable.

title: Okay but not right
text:
I’ve set this up for a few dozen clients and they all seem to like it. Therefore I recently put some switches at my place (mostly things left over from various jobs) and I like having the ability to do everything the app says it will do. Remotely on/off, dimmers, scenes and schedules are truly awesome.

The only thing that really irks me is the sunset/sunrise schedule. It’s entirely inaccurate for me and my clients. Perhaps it’s because I live/work in Phoenix (5th largest metro area in US) Arizona which is a state that doesn’t recognize daylight savings time and that fact confused the developer?
Perhaps it’s because it’s terrible and the makers of the app don’t have access to a calendar/weather? I mean the weather app on my phone has sunrise sunset. Newsflash Lutron: rise/set changes throughout the year.

Having to program ‘an hour after sunrise’ or something similar negates the purpose of having this app and to be quite frank, a mechanical timer would be just as effective at this point. Get your act together.

title: Convenient; needs improvement
text:
We have our kitchen and living room lights connected with the app: ceiling lights, a hanging lamp, in-cabinet lighting and a table lamp are hooked up. With that many switches (some not easily accessible) it’s a significant time saver to automate and we find we use/enjoy our accent lighting more.

The biggest issue for us is when two people in the household have the app; the Leaving Home function will shut off all lighting if one of us leaves while the other stays home. When this happens while I’m in the kitchen with my hands full - and it does - it’s both inconvenient and a hazard.

 As city apartment dwellers we often come and go with our hands full (groceries, trash, deliveries, etc) so having the function has proven to be a huge help and we don’t want to have to shut it off. Developers need to address this so the Leaving Home function deactivates if another app-owner is still home! I’m confident it will be taken into consideration and improved by Lutron’s team soon. 

Overall though, we are loving it.

title: Almost perfect
text: This app works great to easily adjust all 22 shades in our home.  Several are set on a convenient timer.  My only criticism is that the app reports a closed shade in light gray, and an open shade in dark blue.  This is totally counterintuitive to what my brain expects, and I always have to remind myself that the lighter color means “closed,” when I naturally expect it to mean “open.”  Six months in, and I still have to remind myself of this every time I adjust the shades, so I think this is a natural cognitive expectation that the app designers got wrong.  Please fix this.  Light color means open, sunlight.  Dark color means closed, nighttime.  Makes sense, right?

title: I can’t say enough nice things about Lutron
text:
I’ve been in home automation hell for 2 years now. Finally decided to dive into professional grade (RA2 Select) and let me just say you can tell Lutron has a lot of experience in this. They have thought of almost EVERYTHING. Product quality is amazing, apps are good, and their higher end RA2/Select and HomeWorks QS repeaters are developer friendly. 

The only request I have at this point is to please expose buttons on Pico remotes as devices in HomeKit and SmartThings. I’m trying to integrate some hue lights into my system as well and it would make it much easier!

title: Minor tweak
text: Great devices with sleek design.  Installing is pretty easy for someone with basic knowledge.  Support and videos are available for those who need help.  The app is simple to use with sophisticated control.  I would suggest a minor change.  A scene can be designed by the user.  Any particular scene can be turned on with the tap of the icon, but you cannot turn off the scene the same way. You must go in and turn off each individual device.  Can this not be changed with a simple app update?  Thanks

title: Lag improved but app has lost relevance due to device limitation
text: The app does appear to start up a bit faster since last year however it is still much slower than Apple’s home app. In addition, the Lutron app is only limited to the account under which a specific bridge is used. I have reached my 50 Lutron devices limit and if i get another bridge i can’t use both under the same app since each bridge has a different email associated and i would have to log out of one to use the other. I would have to rely on the Apple Home app to aggregate all homekit or all Lutron bridges for that matter which defeats the purpose of using this app.

title: Nice app - little finicky
text:
The app itself is really well done. Setup is a breeze, adding devices and scenes is intuitive and quick. Widget is especially a nice touch. But, it doesn’t seem to respect your high/low trim settings.  I very frequently end up in an unstable flickering state with the lights switching scenes, though it’s impossible to get them to flicker using the wall mount.

Update. Since using the app I’m dealing with endless instability via wall panel AND app. I used these for weeks with no prob before getting app/bridge. Sometimes lights flashing no matter what I hit on Wall Panel and need to use app, sometimes vice versa, and no perceivable rhyme or reason in any of the cases. Rather frustrating

title: Decent but can be better
text: This app works fine in most circumstances but it has some drawbacks and room for improvement. Specifically, the programming for scenes and schedules is a bit clunky.  Also, it does a very poor job of handling more than one smart bride when you have two residences.  You must have two separate accounts which is a pain and you can't use a different photo on each account (it is saved on your phone not in the account profile). It should be possible to easily toggle back and forth between the two. Most other automation apps can handle this.

title: Does what it should and does it well
text: This app allows you to quickly do what you’re trying to do in app. Adding new devices is uneventful. You can easily add “timers” that are pegged to sunrise and sunset so your lights aren’t turning on at 5 PM when it doesn’t get dark until 8 in summer. The whole family can turn on and dim lights from their ipad. We started out with four caseta switches and nearly have the entire house converted because it’s such a great convenience!

title: Cannot integrate with Apple HomeKit /Siri
text:
This version has problem integrating with Apple HomeKit/Siri. I update to IOS 11 and update this app, resulting HomeKit could not control all the light switches. I can only control light switches using the Lutron app. 

I called their support team multiple times follow their instructions to sign out and sign in to iCloud, clear all Setting on the Lutron bridge etc.  And now this become worst!!!  After I clear the setting in the bridge, this Lutron apps can no longer add or integrates with HomeKit. It was very clear the app itself is the problem. But their support wasted my 5 days troubleshooting  for them.  I really wonder How did this app pass the Lutron QA team to release for update ?   Did they not do the test before releasing this app??

title: Great app!
text: Really enjoy the app overall. It’s intuitive and easy to control all smart devices. Setting up scenes is a breeze. I do wish there was more customization when it comes to dimming lights. Phillips Hue has a way to adjust the amount of time it takes the lights to change the brightness, and it’s great. Instead, in order to adjust brightness over the evening, I’ve had to set up several scenes which can be frustrating if for some reason you don’t want the lights to be dimming automatically. Other than that, great app!

title: Not bad, could be better
text:
It would be nice to be able to control the dimming speed turning lights on and off. My wife feels that it takes too long right now.

Ive hit the 50 item limit and can see another 10 devices that would be nice to have. It would be good if the limit were increased, maybe a pro2hub, or if seamless multi hub support worked in the app without signing in and out. No, I’m not going to switch to ra2. I refuse to ever be stuck calling out someone to manage my system.

Alexa support is wonky. Its much more sensitive to phrasing than siri and seems to require long drawn out names for lights when siri seems to just figure it out with natural phrasing. i don’t know if that has to do with lutron or alexa though. I stopped using alexa because of it.

Love the watch support. I too would like to see multi user geofencing, so its not nagging me to turn off the lights even though my wife is home and she also has the app installed.

title: App no longer works for iOS 14
text: The app worked fine until my phone automatically upgraded, and now I can’t add any new devices. I tried using my husbands phone who also has ios14 and the same thing happens . Every time I click on add new device, it goes to the screen to select which device you want to add, and then immediately comes the error message which says an error has occurred and to try again later. Please fix the app to work with iOS 14 so I can add more dimmers to my smart home. I can’t even link them to Alexa because I can’t add them to the Lutron app first. 😔

title: Meh
text: Mostly great app, however it would be great to see the smart Away feature work with HomeKit so that it can be set with the “everyone leaves the home” option. Right now when one person leaves it can trigger smart away when people are still in the house because this app triggers the smart away feature based on one person leaving and can’t track multiple people in the home. If scenes could be trigger to correspond to HomeKit scenes, that would fix the problem. Another way to do it would be to allow it to trigger from IFTTT, but Smart Away won’t trigger from IFTTT.

title: Nice Looking and Frustrating
text: It’s a beautiful app and once you add your devices it’s fairly easy to navigate it. However it’s beauty and simplicity stop there. The interface is non-standard.  If you want to edit a name of a room or modify a device it is a guessing game. I wonder if UX designers and developers believe they’re being clever but forget that with the dozens of other apps, no one wants to a non-standard experience where they have to figure out how to do these things the few times a year it’s required.

title: No Multi-Home Yet
text:
I got the email announcing the new 5.0 version of the app. Nice improvements. It is great that you guys are continuing to make this better. 

But, why have you not built multi-home/multi-bridge into the app yet? If I have a vacation home or a home where I want to use two different bridges it is not possible with Lutron. Unless, of course, you log out and log back into another account. This is a big pain and defeats the purpose of location based settings. I understand it might be hard to implement but every other serious home automation platform supports it today. HomeKit, Nest, etc. Please focus on this. You guys are way behind here.

title: Does most everything
text:
The app is responsive and easy to use, if a bit basic. I waited for a year in hopes of getting multi-user geofencing, but now HomeKit in iOS 11 does it, so I can trigger home and away off that instead.

The room/scene UI improvements are intuitive and align better with HomeKit, but I wasn't really itching for that since I use Echos for most of the control. 

Happy to see the picos able to be hidden, but prior to that, they were already listed below the main switches so it wasn’t a huge hassle.

title: Generally good, buggy Alexa integration
text: The app works wonderfully. However, as of recently, the Alexa integration no longer registers devices with Alexa as light switches but instead outlets it seems. I just added four new switches to my house only to find that Alexa will not recognize them as lights in smart groups, and thus won’t turn them on when I ask it to turn the lights on. The old switches added last month all function as lights. Hope you guys can fix this quirk. Caseta is a wonderful system otherwise!

title: App is too smart for its own good.
text: Everything use to work beautifully. Simple, easy. But now, the app likes to rename my lights.  If I edit them back to the simple name I had, the app changes it back.  When I use to say (with SmartThings/Alexa) “turn on stairs”, now I have to say “turn on living room stairs spot lights”. If I edit the name, it no longer works. I get that this might be a necessary feature for those with multiple houses/ big mansions, but I just have simple stairs. Can you guys make it simple again?

title: Love Lutron
text:
I have been using the app for about 4 years and absolutely love it!
I have been adding stuff over the years and currently have 49 devices connected. I have Serena shades, dimmers, fan controls and the new extender allowed me to put more devices in other areas.
The interface is super stable and the app has been great. I have it all integrated with the Google/Nest ecosystem and it has been flawless.
Thanks Lutron!

title: As of now.
text:
As of now, everything works flawless and to my expectations. Even better than my ecobee 3 thermostat app. I use HomeKit and it works great. But I want to be able to download the app onto our iPad I have the app connected to my iPhone. But when I go to download the app onto our home iPad it tells me that I have to purchase the app is this true? If so why? I noticed that with other versions of your apps to? I did not have to do this when I installed the switch and downloaded the app. 
Thanks 
Tracy.

title: No Wake-up lights function
text: The dimmer itself has such a nice fade-up, fade-down when you activate the lights - it’s bananas that wake-up lights - a slow fade-up over a set period of time - can’t be scheduled easily in the app. Instead I’ve had to make 10 distinct schedules in 5 min intervals to achieve a semi-functional result. Very frustrating as I can’t stop the cycle if I get up before it’s finished and I can’t easily flip it off if I don’t want it on a holiday morning. Please add this feature!

title: Good app and product (with one critique)
text: This product has been a great solution for creating smart lights in my home! My older home doesn’t have neutral wires for the building lights and this is great solution. My only critique is that the lights don’t remember their last dim setting. Would love to see this implemented. Also, I would love there to be a setting were lights would automatically set to dimmer level in the evening. Wemo’s dimmers have this feature

title: Top-Notch app for a top-notch company
text: Everything Lutron makes is just so polished. It costs a little more but with that you get a superior product with outstanding us-based support. I cannot sing praises of this company enough. Enough with fiddling around with the old imported junk and now I deal with Lutron products developed by people who know what they are doing and build it with pride. Simply amazing, amazing, amazing.

title: Worse than dog water
text: Multiple locations their equipment has failed, support doesn’t have a clue what the status lights mean when an error occurs and always defaults to sending a support file which never has an answer to either it’s always default the switch or repeater and when that doesn’t work send in the devices. Complete waste of time and has very slim to none patches that help fix the problem. If you like to waste your time and money I’d definitely go with these guys cause they really know how to do both effectively. Completely an appalling service and product.

title: Downgrade in Usability
text:
For a company that focuses on modern day home streamlining and simplicity, it baffles me that they just don't understand usability. This is the only advantage you have over other products. It's the reason why people buy your products in the first place. If it becomes more annoying to use an app over getting up and adjusting thermostat temperature, then there is no reason to use this in the first place.

Please understand: The less taps/digging users have to go through, the better. That's it. It's really not much harder than this when making a control panel.

Latest update is a huge downgrade over the previous 2 taps to change temperature. If anything, it should've been simplified into one single tap, but now it's worst.

Funny part is I was just about to swap all my switches in my house to Lutron switches, but until they show they understand usability, I'll keep an eye on alternative solutions.

title: UPDATE: Fantastic Customer Support
text:
Love this ecosystem, but after 2 day of using it I find myself frustrated that I have to dismiss a “what’s new” popup every time I open the app! Rid me of this and it would easily be a 5 star experience!

UPDATE - The pop up issue was immediate addressed and resolved over the weekend. What a great show of support by Lutron! Got more smart switches in the way!! As promised - 5 Stars!

title: Only connects when on same network?!
text: Was simple to setup the Caseta system. Love that it supports multiple houses now. When it works, it works great: quick responses by devices, simply programming, astronomical time clock, all good features. However, the app cannot always connect to the devices. And it can ONLY connect when you’re on the same Wi-Fi network as the device hub. Completely defeats the purpose! I want to be able to control my lights when I’m home AND when I’m NOT home. Very disappointing performance & reliability.

title: Works good... but
text: This devices work fine and i love them, actually i like to install these switches at my costumers houses, The only problem i have with its that u can only install one repeater in the entire house, sometimes the cube its too far o so many walls in between or switch inside cabinets and cant reach signal from cube, specially in old houses that want to updateor add  a system, is there another way to get a stronger signal from cube?... other than that great app and devices

title: Great system
text: I love the ability to control everything from my phone.  A few improvements. I think the scenes should be a toggle when you click on it.  It's weird that I have to create a whole other scene just to turn off the scene I created.  Also I think it's weird that I can't put a scene in a schedule.  I have to recreate that entire light setup a second time.  Otherwise love the app

title: The schedule feature is not working
text: The schedule feature does not seem to be working at all. When I had have them set up to turn on at sunset and turn off at sunrise, they turn on too early when it’s still sunny and bright. I deleted all the schedule and added new schedules to have them turn on at 7:30 pm. However, they  do not function according to the updated schedule. They still turn on at 4:00 pm.

title: Excellent App
text:
I love the new update, clean, easy the follow, very intuitive. Thank you Lutron! 5 stars

I have a couple of suggestions:
1. Could you add another tab called “Rooms” and subtab to be able to select a room and each room tab to list all the devices present in that room.
2. Could you add the ability of users to take a picture of the surroundings and upload it the respective room so when the user picks the room the picture is in the background.

Thank you,

Previous Review
I would have given the app 5 starts if wasn't for the almost weekly server outage. I have many caseta switches and it is annoying when I cannot connect to them while on vacation. The app is very clean and excellent layout.

title: Great!! But IFTTT Trigger Integration Please
text:
This app is amazing, the devices are easy to set up, and the response time from when you command a scene or device to when you see something happen is nearly instantaneous.

IFTTT triggers please - My only complaint and it’s a big one for my specific smarthome set up is that you cannot use the Lutron switches as triggers (if “this”) to control other devices. You can only have your Lutron system respond to commands made by other devices including competing switch provider....

title: Great improvements
text:
Please add pico remotes to homekit. 

New updates are great regarding smart away and works with nest. It would be nice with a few fine tunes. Like not having to relay on phone location or nest to automatically set smart away. So you can use it at night when you are home. 
Also be nice to be able to select individual cameras to turn on select lights. So the garage cam only turns on garage lights etc.

title: Customer support is great.
text: I spent two hours trying to get a three switch light done. Finally called Customer Care and had it working with in minutes.  Should’ve done that from the start.   Was on hold for a brief moment until someone came on.  Not only are their products amazingly great but their support is just as good.  It’s no wonder they are dominating the industry.

title: New updated interface is a major upgrade!
text:
Gets expensive but these are the Best on the market for sure. 

Works as advertised, currently have over 20 switches installed. The arriving/leaving setting is great! I have it linked with my Xfinity Home app for added security features an having lutron link flawlessly with apples HomeKit is also a plus. Completely satisfied customer.

title: Best smart switches / really bad app.
text:
I gave this 3 stars only because Lutron Caseta is the best smart switch on the market. It works with HomeKit and every other platform. 

Luton Caseta Hardware: 5 stars. 
Lutron Caseta App: 1 star. 

This app, is pretty bad. Bad design and it’s slow. 

But the beauty of Caseta, is that you can use the apple Home app to control all of these devices. That works amazingly well!

So you only need to use this app once when you install a new device. After that, close it and forget about it. Use the home app and enjoy the best smart switch platform on the market. 

If they redesign the app someday, it’d be nice. I wonder if this ever scares away potential customers. Who knows. Their hardware engineers are much more talented than the UX designers.

title: Color scheme is beyond depressing
text: I don’t understand why the changes to the layout that were made —which frankly are just changes, not better — had to be made at the cost of turning a beautiful appearing app into something so lifeless. The black background and the vibrant flowers that were part of the app originally were a joy to look at. How can anyone think this app is more visually appealing?  I am sad every time I have to use this now, it’s like losing the ability to see in color. I’m even more disheartened when I think about the fact that someone actually chose this lack of color scheme.

title: Light timers
text:
This app is great.  It is formatted differently than what I am used to seeing.  If you are controlling lights that you want to turn on and off you have to set 2 events.  One to turn them on, and one to turn them off.   

Once you get the hang of that you are off to the races!!

My wife and I plan on adding more devices into our smart home to use with this app.

title: Great improvements just need one more thing
text:
Update:  Gave it one more star.  Developer is REALLY responsive.  Makes this an all around great product!

Great improvements in naming and the ability to move rooms around. One more thing, can you give us the ability to move a device within a room. Otherwise it is solid and the switches are fantastic.

title: Disappointed
text:
Honestly I’m disappointed with the product. For the cost, there are so many lighting options out there. Basic stuff like timers set for “sunset” and “sunrise” don’t work. It’s hit or miss if the lights are on when I get home.

UPDATE: Why require location services - we’re capable of providing location to you without that being a sunrise/sunset requirement and it still does not work. If you spent more money on proper app development rather than whatever you pay for data aggregation (and probably sell my privacy) we’d have a functional product that still costs more than HUE. Meh, I wish I would have skipped buying the whole light kit and went with a better cheaper option. Sad.

UPDATE 2:
Your response does not address my concern, nor does it address non-functional features. Fix your horrible UI and broken features.

title: Great BUT not built for users
text:
Usually works well - very well.  But sorely in need of a usability review:
Each programming of a device requires 2 schedules, an on and an off.  This leaves you with a long list of schedules that appear in no discernible order.  Need folders and ability to organize / group schedules.
The pencil icon used for editing a schedule is unreasonably small - every time I go to edit I inadvertently trigger the schedule.
And more.
Now version 6.2 has ability to render icons in color.  First, big deal.  Second, how - there are no instructions.

title: Stupendous
text:
Upgraded my whole home with Caesta over a year ago. This was a great decision. However, now that I’m accustomed I can never go back.

The widget allow me to have quick scene control at all times. The automation and integration with other devices, such as Nest and Alexa, have made it so I often go weeks without actually touching a light switch in the traditional manner.

title: Not a fan of the new app
text: Echoing many other reviews, I am definitely not a fan of the new UI. Before all the lights/switches were in one section and I could easily turn on and off things without any scrolling. Now the app makes it so you have a section for each room and doesn't give the option of putting everything under one main section. Sometimes less complicated is better... please revert back to the old UI of having all the switches and devices just listed under a My Home section

title: Poor quality
text: This app doesn’t work well at all. After buying the very expensive $110 bridge I can connect bridge to my WiFi and the remote to the app but cannot figure out how to control the lights with the remote on app - no directions makes life hard - directions that came with lights refer to app once downloaded - should be step by step - nope... no help at all. Doesn’t look like the remote on the app offers much more of a difference then the actual remote that came with the lights- Life is much easier and way cheaper if just using the remote that came with the lights.

title: Works great
text:
One of the few smart home apps that always seem to work together with Siri.

That’s more than could be said about IKEA and many other smart home apps that can barely connect to a lamp most of the time.

Maybe the startup time of the Lutron app could be improved, my only feedback.

title: Doesn't connect
text: I connected the bridge and it went through it's firmware update fine. When I tried to connect a device - my outdoor garage light, which by the way, works fine with the four remote switches I have in my home, guest house and two cars - I get to the point where I hold the bottom button of the wall-mounted switch for 10 seconds until the LED begins to flash quickly and nothing else happens. The app just sits there. If I back out the app says "finishing setup" and that's it. No device is added.

title: Update- Love the app-
text: I was able to find the fix for the sunrise/sunset time discrepancy in the settings. As a new user, so far, I love the app. Would recommend at this time. Very convenient to be able to turn things off and on from the phone-especially when you go to bed and can’t remember if you left a light on in a detached garage!

title: Miss some elements of old UI
text: Miss the dark UI option. Miss being able to have my own pic as the background. The tabbed interface is not necessarily better. Adding rooms for an existing device is a bit confusing -  you have to edit the device. There is no high level menu for rooms. I do like the quick link to all lights that are on. Overall it's a decent update but it needs some further work. Bring back the dark theme please.

title: A long way to go
text: For some reason the team seems focused on making superficial improvements to the app instead of adding function, like conditional switching (ie: at 11pm, on switch only turns on the light dim) or long hold switching (long hold of on turns the light on full, or turns the whole room on). I really wish they would add functionality like that instead of allowing me to change the background photo on my app.

title: Works all the time
text: This may not be as full featured as some people want, but I love the app and Caseta because it works so well. The app always controls my lights and always works correctly. The system is not perfect, but in a world with so many flaky wireless things, this has been a really good system.

title: Nice solution to control your lamps but weak app support
text:
Nice solution to control your home light but the designer of the application doesn’t understand smart home. Who designed this and decided to use the phones location as the location of the home and no way to manually set the time zone where my home is?
So use schedules for turning lights on and off when traveling will not work.

title: Time zone functionality
text: Solid app. The one improvement is to add time zone support. You need to be able to set schedules in the time zone where your home is located, even if you are setting the schedule while you are traveling in a different time zone. I tried to set schedules for our home in NYC while traveling in Hawaii, and the only way to do it was to use schedules based on Hawaii time (which clearly was not relevant to the use case).

title: Watch app Needs fine grained light control
text:
Great start on the watch app. Disappointed this lacks the full range of dimming control you get with the iPhone app or the pick remote. 4 dimming levels (including full off and full on) are not enough. Please add the feature to select a light individually and control brightness with the watch wheel. 

the iPhone app itself is great.

title: This update is fast!
text: This update really sped up the app launch time! I love that you can schedule lights to be turn on and off based on sunrise and sunset with the ability to define and offset (e.g. turn on lights at sunset + 15 minutes). I would love to see the interface further refined and cleaned up to make it easier to use and more modern looking.

title: Crash Crash Crash
text: The app worked great until the last update. Now, it crashes constantly and then freezes. Once that happens, there’s no rescuing it. I’ve had to delete the app and then reinstall it several times. I’m almost afraid to open it now. Instead, I’ve been controlling devices in my Alexa app. It’s wonkier and extra steps… but at least it isn’t freezing. Please fix whatever has changed.

title: Works but limited to a single controlling device!
text:
Got the bridge all connected to dimmer switches, setup account, but cannot login in on other devices with the account I setup. Reset everything and tried again, with no success on connecting multiple devices (phones/iPads). Called in to the tech support that according to Lutron’s website is available 24 hours 7 days a week. Found that they are only available during weekday business hours, (this is understandable just advertise as such) 
All around disappointing

title: Great system and good app, but...
text: I've love my system and the app works great, but I wish the schedule feature allowed on/off settings. You have to create different schedules for off times, which is annoying to manage when trying to adjust for things like daylight savings time.

title: Devices don’t consistently connect
text: I have many wall switches and plug-in switches and getting them to consistently connect was not happening. I spoke to support who walked me through resetting and reconnecting. It was also identified that a wireless extender was needed for some. I was able to eventually get the complete system working.

title: Some simple improvements would go a long way
text:
I just installed my numerous dimmer switches throughout our new home. Very easy to setup and install.
One oversight in the app (hopefully it’s fixed in next update), is that in ‘Schedules’ you can only set the TURN ON time, you can’t set the lights to TURN OFF. So tour lights stay on all night if they are on a schedule.

title: Superb App
text: I have been using this app (and its updates) for a few years to control more than 30 Lutron switches/dimmers in my home.  From controlling my circulation pumps to driveway lights to interfacing with Nest protect, it is really impressive. I look forward to continued improvements and functionality.  Truly an amazing product.

title: Great starter home light kit
text:
I have been using caseta light dimmers and Blinds for 5 years. Tech support had been great and even replaced a blind for me after it feel while changing the battery’s. With that said. So new features I’d love to see would be 

system back up 
Custom UI 
Home Screen Widgets 
Lighting affects 
Recommend Smart scenes

Thanks for everyone at Lutron for the amazing customer service. P.s for those complaining about limited stuff with a Caseta product maybe you should think about their premium products that offer 15x more I’d say then Caseta.

title: Barebones and Buggy
text: The app is very barebones in functionality. That’s ok because I’d rather use the Home app in iOS to control my lights anyways. However, there is a glaring bug that I noticed: adding a device to an existing HomeKit room seems to be impossible. Even though the app lists all the rooms in HomeKit, if I select one it says I must create a new room as that room already exists. Why is that a requirement? Makes no sense.

title: Lights turned on by themselves  couple of times. Good product but lacks key features like log
text:
Good product have using for 8 months...but needs updates!!!

Recently we had our lights turned ON by itself  and it freaked my wife out!!

Need one additional functionality in the app to get a log of when what light were turned on and off and which mobile device was used or manually turned on/off.

title: Very Convenient
text: I started using the app sometime this summer.  The interface is confusing at first but I like being able to set different scenarios for my lights and also for having the ability to control the lights from afar.  Good job!  Please keep up the support!

title: Integration with home security
text: I have the ring home security.  It would be a nice feature to integrate it with the alarm system so when the smoke detector goes off it turns on all the lights.  Maybe this is something to integrate with ring and/or Alexa.

title: Problem Solved - App stopped working
text:
The app completely stopped working for me, it won’t even load and Alexa can’t turn the lights on nor off anymore.

- Edit

I power cycled the bridge and everything went back to normal.

title: UX Needs Work
text: When setting up a dimmer there’s no indication that the dimmer should be connected before the pico remote. Also you appear to be at the last step of set up for a device but there’s still more to do. You have to tap in further. Works well once set up but clunky as were the printed instructions.

title: App stopped working
text: When I open the app now it just has the “thinking spinning icon” and won’t react. I can’t turn light on or off, add new schedules, or even go into the settings. No update is offered. I tried deleting the app and reinstalling it but to no avail, and now all my schedules are gone and I can’t put them back in.

title: Not ideal when loses power to home
text: I have had several brown outs at my home and it is annoying that I have to re-sync my Lutron devices! Would not be so bad, but I have to sign out, in-link my account, and then try 4 or 5 times to re-connect it to my google home assistant. I thought it was my google being temperamental, but this has happened to a few other friends using either Alexa or Google. What’s up Lutron? Please fix this!

title: Good app, great service.
text: Not everything is perfect but I have had no problems with the basic programming. I had a little issue with the app and I reached out to customer service and they were very responsive and helped me fix it pretty quickly!

title: Underwhelming
text: Bought the bridge to go along with some lutron switches I had from an old job that were RF switches... got everything setup and found out the vive switches I had aren’t compatible with the bridge but the bridge knows their signal. The app even lets you know it recognizes the device but it doesn’t allow it to be added. Strictly caseta switches

title: Would be so much better if Siri worked with scenes
text: Being able to create scene in which lights dim and Sonos Amp (older version) plays an Internet radio station is a capability I can’t find anywhere else, and it’s not in Apple Home Kit. Thanks for providing this! But it would be so much better if I could use Siri to start my Lutron app scenes!

title: There were problems for awhile, but all fixed nowis broken
text:
The app is now back to amazing.  This app works perfectly.  New devices are easy to integrate and the functionality is terrific.

Like the best technology, this system is simple and it works every time.

title: Worked great until recently….widgets stopped showing up
text: Have had the system for years with zero problems. Recently, none of my widgets will load any more and the app has become slow as molasses to load. Sometimes it doesn’t work at all and has become very unreliable. SUPER disappointed…..I have 2 bridges and tons of dimmers (I’m maxed out), so a lot invested in something that has has taken a very wrong turn. FIX THIS APP!

title: Push notifications?
text: The app is pretty decent. It would be great if there was an option to get notification at to when the lights go on and off. If there is a way to enable those I haven’t found them, so let me know. If there is not a way then can you creat that option? Thanks!

title: Not too bad
text:
I love the app, and love the Caseta system even more. 
One thing I would like is the ability to sort devices. They are currently in the order I programmed them. I would like to either order them any way I want (maybe by my personal use or by location), or at least, alphabetical.

title: Update renamed most devices
text: Just finished setting up my home last week. Had scenes and schedules all set. This latest update renamed most of my devices. I have no clue what’s what now! Scenes still work but I can’t add new ones until I figure out where these devices are. My garage suddenly has a lot of Caseta devices. LOL. Just an irritation.

title: Now best lighting on market
text: Now with the iPad app these switches come a long way and a amazing system I have the limit 50 of them wish I could add more hopefully they will expand it in the future !! Best home innovation out amazing system!! Highly recommend

title: Why no lights off time for schedule?
text:
Love the schedules and ease of operation.
But can’t understand why there is no option for ending your light schedule. I know, complaining I have to manually turn them off sounds lame. But hey, I paid for this operation (I thought).

Other than this problem, they are great.

title: My lights turn off when I leave but my spouse is home
text: It would be great if the Lutron app could recognize if someone else is at a home for the geofencing... I leave for work while my spouse is still home and all the lights turn off when I leave... a fix for this and it would be 5 stars!!!!

title: Missing Features
text:
Can't control the speed of the "turn off the house" scene. Need 30 seconds to leave, lutron gives you 2 seconds.

Bought a special 4 button keypad that I wanted to control 4 scenes. It can only control 1 scene, which ruins everything for the wife. She now has to  have 4 of these things on her nightstand and I need 3. Same thing for living room. They need to make the 4 button unit do 4 things!

title: Good But Needs Work!
text:
Haven't had any of the problems others have mentioned. 

However I would like to see more icons for scenes.

They also desperately need an iPad version where the screen can rotate to Landscape!

I have a dedicated iPad for home control and using this app on it is pretty pathetic.

Update:

I appreciate that the app now works with iPads but hate the idea that we cannot arrange the order of Devices or Scenes, they are just in Alphabetical Order. Really really bad!

Not really sure what order Schedules are in, but those too the order cannot be change. 

But overall the system works good.

title: Great app, one question....
text:
Since day one this has been the most reliable HomeKit apps as well as devices.  I had my entire house re-wired all with Lutron (HK) dimmer switches. I only wish this app was capable of controlling ALL HomeKit devices. Is that at in all in any future plans? 
Otherwise great app. 
THANKS.

title: Locked out of account, password reset doesn’t work
text: The Lutron app worked fine for about a year. I opened it up to add a dimmer last week and I’ve been unauthenticated, requiring me to sign in again. The “Forgot your password?” link/process appears to be broken. It indicates the email is a valid account, but no email is ever received. I’ve tried about 20 times now, checked my spam folder, nothing.

title: IPhone application stopped working
text: The loutron application stopped working on my iPhone and I cannot get it to work again, while the application that sits on my iPad works fine. I talked to a Loutron representative and he could not get my one light switch to pair with my app.  He said he is sending me a new switch, but for some reason I don’t think that’s going to resolve things.

title: Easy to use and set up
text: Easy to use and set up, I have numerous switches and dinners including a switch for operating my water shutoff device.  Would like more info on controlling my Ring Cameras and how to integrate.

title: Does the job, but little else
text: The app and the hubs are reliable but very basic. Other products have more functionality, and when I ask for gradual dimming or other feature, Lutron says your smart app can do that (meaning HomeKit, SmartThings, etc.). Guess what, Lutron, YOU are supposed to be a smart app, only kinda dumb. Starting to regret buying into this system.

title: Basic functionality missing
text: Got a QSX system and was looking to use the Lutron app but it seems to be missing functionality from the Caseta app. For instance, I can’t figure out how to change the icons for loads. Right now, everything has a lightbulb icon (instead of a chandelier or sconce icon) - which makes it difficult to tell what is what.

title: No longer works with Alexa
text: Just updated the Lutron App for iOS and it no longer works with Alexa. Delinking and resetting the skill did not work.  Bridge is ok and still works with HomeKit.  Very upsetting given my whole house is eco’s and Casetta switches.

title: Much better launch time now!
text:
Finally they fixed the slow launch problem.
Now the app starts instantly and can actually control things!

title: Stopped Working After Update
text:
I have not been able to use my Lutron devices since this last update, at least not with the app. They work manually, but that’s it.

Update: there seemed to be a conflict with Nest. I removed Lutron from Nest and things started to work as normal.

title: Works great
text:
Update: after working with AmpliFi finally got the app working. Now 5 stars.

I put in a new router now the app won’t connect! Talked to both lutron and Amplifi and neither of them can fix. Would give zero stars if I could.

The app is great and Lutron products are solid. My few wishes now are that Lutron make controllable outlets, and also allow the pico remote to pair with the app for HomeKit functionality.

After months now, Lutron products have been SOLID and worked great with HomeKit. Thanks devs

title: The idea is great
text: I love the Lutron products in our home. The ability to program on/of as well as dimming has been lovely! Using the app to set up the schedule went very well. However, if I want to turn the lights on/off using the app as I’m sitting in my living room, the app doesn’t want to connect to the accessory. I do have fast enough internet to stream, so I’m not sure what’s going on.

title: Needs Gradual Light Increase Over atoms
text: This app would be amazing IF it could set a level of brightness to be illuminated over time, like imitating a sunrise or sunset. Right now you can set the level of brightness, but not increase or decrease it gradually, make that happen and you’ll have 5 stars.

title: Broken on iOS 14
text:
App immediately crashes upon launch on iOS 14

-update: increased score since fix was implemented. Lighting control works extremely reliably.

title: Slooooooow
text: App is way too slow to load.  Room names is annoying and you have to scroll and scroll and scroll if you have a few.  50 device limit should not count the pico remotes. It should be switches only.  I really want to buy more... but Lutron has capped my ability to do so through the 50 device limit.  That is money left on the table for you guys!

title: Expensive switches and lacks features
text: The switches are so expensive overall works very well. Lacks very important features with competitors name such as timer and auto shut off for certain time.  Hope they add these features.

title: Could be better
text:
Consistently shows lights off yet they are on.

Updated review: my lights were out of range and after getting a range extender (Lutron plug-in dimmer ), works perfectly. Updated to 5 stars.

title: Overall Great
text: These have been very solid and reliable, especially through HomeKit. I just wish I could set on/off fades for a duration of time. e.g., turn on bedroom lights to 50% brightness over the span of 15 minutes.

title: App doesn’t run unless phone nearby
text: Until recently I would have given this a 5 star rating. However, now the Lutron app on my Apple Watch won’t run unless my iPhone is nearby. This makes the app on my watch useless.  I’ve re-installed the app on my phone and watch with no success. Hopefully Lutron will address this.

title: Better, white background hard on eyes!
text:
Improved organization!
White background is harsh, hard to see symbols and text. Suggest option to change background and text or fix it as black background and orange text.

title: Accuracy of Lights
text: I have come to love my Lutron. However we have noticed that current status of lights is not depicted in the app.  For example, one light could be on, but the app says it’s off. The brightness of less is also different.  It was not like this before.  What changed?

title: Missing features
text:
I had some issue connecting to the bridge at at first. The app is good and easy to use. My major heartburn is there is not the basic option to sequence the turning on or off of each light in a scene. It's ether all on/dim or all off. This would really come in handy when leaving or enter a floor level.
Why Didn't I get a Response from the Development Team???? HELLO

title: Awful update.
text: I used to be able to ask “Alexa turn on the kitchen”.  And it worked.  Now because of the new grouping of rooms I have to ask “Alexa turn on the kitchen kitchen”.  And “alexa turn on master bedroom master” instead of just master.  The second floor has become “hallway second floor”.   The room naming grouping has propagated into alexa and now we need the full description command without a way to shorten it?!?  Please fix this.  It is awful.

title: Crashes every launch—used to work great
text: For the past three days the app continues to crash every time it is launched. I’ll see the splash screen for 5-10 seconds then it crashes and I’m back at the Home Screen. This app has been pretty rock solid for 6 months, I’ve invested in >20 switches, but now doesn’t work at all and I’m beginning to regret it.

title: Feedback
text: The app works fine and is easy to navigate. What would be nice though, is to be able to rearrange the order of the lights within a room.

title: Reliable System. But need to allow more than 75 devices
text: Highly reliable system.  Need to allow more than 75 devices to make it perfect

title: Easiest Light System Ever
text: Received as gift. 15 mins installed. Can control 4 light switches and 3 plugs from wall, phone app, Pico remote included OR my Apple Watch. Totally cool and everything works as advertised and simple to do. Lurton stuff is the best.

title: lights look real nice, clark
text: due to my own stupidity I thought there wasn’t a way to set a schedule to turn lights out, but once I realized that schedules are essentially scenes and lights could be set to 0%, i was all set!

title: Good - but could easily be so much better
text:
I installed the Caseta system in our house a couple of weeks ago. Installation was a really smooth experience: the system really simplifies wiring (effectively, turning three-pole switches back into single pole switches, controlled by wireless remotes), allows for lots of customisation (like being able to control multiple lights in a room with one button press), and is a great improvement on all the manual switches we had before.

 

Overall, I’m impressed – but there are a couple of seemingly obvious things that have been overlooked.

Firstly, my partner and I both have iPhones – but Lutron’s geofencing isn’t smart enough to tell when one of us is home and the other is out, and only switch lights on if we’re both out, for example. If I turn the option on and leave, all the lights go off, leaving my husband in darkness. Not all that smart, right? There’s a workaround if you have a Nest device that can be set to determine whether someone’s home, but if you don’t have one, this isn’t an option. If our thermostat can get this right, why can’t Lutron?

 

And then there’s the Siri/HomeKit integration. I love being able to tell Siri to “turn the kitchen lights on” or “set the living room lights to 50%” – but why doesn’t HomeKit see the Scenes I’ve set up in the Lutron app, too? If I tell Siri to “set the lights to Evening”, she tells me she doesn’t know what I’m talking about. Again, there’s a workaround: you can duplicate these Scenes as new Scenes in HomeKit – but it seems like an oversight. And, at time of writing, the Lutron app isn’t supported for the Shortcuts app, either.

 

Finally, we need a better way to make “tweaks” to Scenes that have already been set up. Live editing isn’t possible, and neither is it possible to “grab” the way the lights are set in a room and store that as a Scene. This means, if I decide I want to make changes, that I have to go into each device, one by one, make a note of the dimming level, then manually enter it in the Scene afterwards. This should be a simple fix in a future update, but will it happen?

 

A little more thought would make this a killer app and system. Right now, I’d say we’re at 3 out of 5.

title: NEEDS SOME ENHANCEMENTS
text:
I’ve been a LUTRON customer for more than 20 years with these types of dimmers - they are the best on the market for the REGULAR, NON-SMART NON-CASETA ONES. 

Just a week or so ago I decided to make my whole house ‘smarter’ when it came to lighting and a thermostat. I had all the nice regular Lutron dimmers that only have 2 BUTTONS and the hidden kill switch, like the CASETA line does as well.  

The ORIGINAL DESIGN was SUPER SLEEK/SIMPLE & EFFECTIVE: the MAIN of 2 buttons was a SINGLE LARGE TAP STYLE BUTTON, which you tapped once to turn ON/OFF the lights; TAPPED TWICE to turn on LIGHTS ON IN FULL BRIGHTNESS, or PRESSED & HELD for 10 seconds so it’d give you 30 seconds to exit the room fully lit and then it’d slowly dimmed to warn you it was turning off. 

SECOND BUTTON was a THIN ROCKER STYLE (push upper side to raise brightness or bottom side to lower it); and it still had 10 tiny green LED’s next to rocker button to indicate brightness level. 

Many of these ‘non-smart’ dimmers could even be CONFIGURED MANUALLY by clicking each of these buttons in certain sequences to set the max/low voltage you wanted lights to receive to accommodate the different types of bulbs, and other features like the ones with incorporated MOTION SENSORS (those are DEVINE - configuration options are so plenty, you’ll need the manual for sure). 

The other BEAUTIFUL THING about the ‘dumb’ dimmers was that once you set a BRIGHTNESS LEVEL using the ROCKER BUTTON, you’d only need to tap the MAIN BUTTON and lights would always turn on at that LAST/DESIRED BRIGHTNESS. 

The new ‘SMART’ CASETA DIMMERS LOOK ALMOST IDENTICAL, but for some reason LUTRON felt it needed to add TWICE AS MANY BUTTONS and COMPLICATE what was a SUPER SIMPLE DESIGN & OPERATION. 

Irony is that now I get LESS FEATURES with these new dinners with more buttons, plus now new buttons also make it hard to press them since they are CRAMMED in the SAME AMOUNT of REAL-ESTATE - there are 4 BUTTONS where there was ONLY ONE BEFORE. 

Now, if I turn the lights, I have to click the dedicated ON BUTTON, but they DONT RESUME at the LAST BRIGHTNESS LEVEL, but at FULL BRIGHTNESS, and then you need to CLICK 10 TIMES the LOWER BRIGHTNESS BUTTON to reduce light output; or ALTERNATIVELY, turn lights on SLOWLY by CLICKING THE BRIGHTNESS ’UP’ BUTTON 10 TIMES - what????? I can’t even recall what was was my desired brightness for this lamp, let alone all in the house. 

How’s this progress? I’m hoping there’s a setting I’ve missed somewhere in the app, or the switches’ manual, that set lights to turn on at last dimmer value. 

To get around this major issue (for me - have lots of mood lighting), you either need to CREATE A ‘SCENE’ ON THE PHONE APP - and run to pull out your phone, unlock it, and find the app, then find the scene, EVERY TIME you want to turn on a light (when the physical dimmer is one touch away right next to you)? 

OR, the other option I found is to BUY ONE PICO REMOTE PER LIGHT SWITCH, which contains an ADDITIONAL FITH TINY BUTTON in the center, and the ONLY VALUABLE BUTTON, which can be programmed to turning the lights on at a PRESET DESIRED BRIGHTNESS.

What a FAIL. I hope like I said: that I either missed something, or that this will be fixable via through some sort of FIRMWARE UPDATE at some point. 

And I do have the problem on rare occasions where not all lights turn on when I choose a SCENE. 

I have about 10 LIGHT CASETA DIMMERS and another 10 CASETA LAMP DIMMERS (and more to come). House is small one floor 1500SF and no solid walls. However, this issue is rare and mostly happens if I press one scene too soon after another. 

Oh!, and some LED lights DONT FULLY TURN OFF when I turn off the LAMP DIMMER - I’m guessing they need very light current to turn them on. 

SIMILARLY, several of the lights ONLY DIM SO MUCH. Even when dimmer is set at 1% in app, light lights at 25-30%. In the old ‘dumb’ dimmers, the LOW/TOP VOLTAGE LEVELS could be adjusted until light turned fully off - not here that I can tell. 

So how can more buttons and ‘smart’ Wifi capabilities actually end up REDUCING functionality? Beats me.
