text: IFTTT and Sonos integration is no longer working ☹️ Please fix!

title: Great But Would Love The Ability to Reorganize.
text:
I have been using the application and system in my 4,000 square foot home for almost 3 months with no issues.  I have a ton of light switches that I have been replacing with the Lutron Caseta Switches (both stand alone and the one that include the pico remotes).  My only two recommendations are this.

1.  I wish the application would have the ability to let you reorganize how the light switches appear in order in the application along with reorganizing scenes as well.  I started one room and added switches over the course of the month.  Then I realized that I have to scroll to the end of the list to use lights I thought I wouldn't touch that much.

2.  It would also be nice to be able to click a scene once activated and have it deactivate completely rather than creating a separate scene or having to manually turn off each switch configured for that scene.

title: Poor app great devices
text:
Thankfully their devices support HomeKit and the only reason you need their app is to pair their devices and add them to your HomeKit home. The setup is a bit iffy given that they require a login (they want your email) which is completely unnecessary. They then require you keep an account or they un-pair and disconnect any Caseta device that you've added to the hub. This is odd given that HomeKit only requires pairing via the HomeKit digits/code. 

Anyway, once paired you don't ever have to use their app which tries to restrict you to their brand partners.

The HomeKit framework lets any true HomeKit app (Elgato Eve is an excellent example) to control their devices via scenes, timers, and rules and of course their is Siri too. I think their design flaw is that they've created a device that lets them play with as many protocols and frameworks as possible and this is why they default to requiring a login account for setup. In case you don't use their hub an devices via HomeKit. They should make that optional.

title: Almost perfect
text: I have 3 separate switches and dimmers, each with either wall mounted or loose Pico’s.  I got the smart bridge to be able to schedule certain lights to come on at sunset and go over later.  Everything works as designed. Except I can’t get Siri Integration to work on my iPhone.  I did get it to work on my iPad Mini.  So despite, toggling on/off keychain, and doing reset on HomeKit, and even re-installing app.  No luck.  Not critical, but would be nice if that worked too.  I have IOS 9.0.2 on both devices.  Even tried this on a older iPhone which I’m running 9.1 Beta 4 on and that didn’t work on that phone either. It gets to the spot where it asks for the name of the home, and after trying it says Unable to Add that.  Like I said early, except for that feature works great.

title: Horrible company - terrible products
text:
I remodeled a new home. Bought for $60+K of Lutron gears (Radio Ra2): NOTHING works as promised. They refuse to fix THEIR hardware problems, keep pointing fingers (not our fault, the dealer is the guilty party). I used 3 different dealers: same stories. One of them even took $2K from me to place the order for an automated shade, Lutron apparently canceled him out as a dealer after I placed the order and I never got my $2K back (nor the shade). Sensors are horrible (don't work as promised, randomly trigger or don't trigger,...). Switches have random issues. It looks like they "leak" electricity: some lights stay on 24h a day at very low level, you might only see them at night. Sometimes they don't turn on... believe me you don't want to buy anything from them. The only thing they do well is take your money and tell you it is not their problem...
One more thing they do well: keep you on hold on the phone or transfer you with a dropped call.

title: Suggestions
text: Reliability of the app and server have improved tremendously. What I am waiting for is way, either through the app or through IFTTT, to enable an entire set of scheduled events in one click.  In other words, if I am on my way to our vacation home, I should be able to enable all of the lighting to follow a schedule designed for being there my pressing one button, not by individually enabling each scheduled event.  When I leave I should be able to switch it to an away schedule with one click. If this is too advanced for an app, provide desktop software. The functionality of this app, as it is, is quite limited.

title: Love the system, but....
text:
This last update for the Smart Away seems to have mistakes in the times?   6pm to 11pm but not one of my lights are on after 10pm. Checked multiple times now.  
This needs to be corrected.  And, if my wife leaves in the middle of the day and I'm home - the porch light goes on sending her an text message, shouldn't the system know I'm home?  Why dues it turn on anyway in the middle of the day?   Might have to call this one in.  
Now, (1) how about letting the user determine the time frame for Smart Away instead of locking it in to your predetermined times?   
Also, (2) how about allowing the user to decide the light intensity of the various lights programmed when using Smart Away?

title: This app needs work
text: This app is a great concept, but it doesn't work yet.  The manual controls work fine, but the scheduled controls don't seem to work at all. The information in the app is so thin as to be useless. Does the app need to be running in the background for scheduled events to work (I sure hope not)?  Do you have to enable location services on your mobile device to use the sunrise/sunset functions (again, I hope not since the device isn't always in the same time zone as the home)?  What iCloud functions have to be enabled to use multiple mobile devices to control the same home?  How do you change/edit the name of a device?  Good luck finding the answers to any of these questions. Any app that requires a CALL to support to work doesn't deserve more than 1 star. I still can't get my lights to go on at sunset.

title: Needs a lot of work!
text:
1. Adding a new dimmer the first time prompts for you to select the HomeKit room to assign to the dimmer. Immediately adding a second dimmer ("add another device") skips the room assignment. This is a bug. The room has to be manually assigned afterwards for the second and third dimmers and so forth.

2. Lutron "scenes" are not true HomeKit scenes and can't be accessed via Siri - no excuse for this, make the Lutron scenes compatible or the same as true HomeKit scenes or name theme something different to avoid consumer confusion

3. Scenes sort in the order they are created and cannot be resorted - this is lazy programming, allow manual and/or alphabetical sort, please!

4. Smart Bridge firmware update fails unless the device is plugged directly into the Wifi base station/router - switches aren't supported for firmware updates. That's a pretty serious bug or design short coming the app ought to at least detect and explain to the user.

5. App startup is quite slow

6. App often fails to add new dimmers successfully, even when they are adjacent to the base station, and steps must be repeated multiple times to get dimmers registered.

title: Home automation
text:
Lutron is my first foray into home automation and I must say they make it pretty simple. Everything worked out of the box as expected. Looking forward to expanding it beyond the two plug in and one wall dimmers I have now.

Update:  what an epic failure. Siri integration has now failed. All I keep getting is 'unable to find smart bridge'.  Guess it's going back to the store. What a shame!

Another update. Turns out the  issue is NOT with Lutron, but rather Apple's poor implementation of HomeKit. Outside the HomeKit part, the system works 100% (just don't rely on Siri integration).

title: Not as good as WeMo
text: As a builder I like to experiment with different wifi devices so I just installed the Caseta bridge, dimmer & remote with the app on iPhone at a client's home... So far the app works... sometimes and the jury is still out on whether the scenes I set up will work tonight (sunset on and 9:30 pm off)..... I don't like that I had to set 2 different scenes (one for on and another for off) and that scheduled scenes don't show up on the home page..... I will amend this review once the scenes are tested..... PS my WeMo (gave that 5 stars) is much easier to use & works like a charm (only one scene to set on & off).... I will say that the set up & install of the Caseta was simple & painless

title: Very slow
text: Our experience is the same as those who say performance has slowed considerably. 50 limit is silly when Lutron hopes you will use their switches to control an increasing number of products. They are running the risk of having a product that isn't keeping up.  I am sure this will trigger another annoying standard response like others have received from Lutron.

title: Reliable controlling light switches
text:
It gets the job done. I've been using this app to control caseta light switches for almost a year without any major complaints.
I programmed switches to turn on and off relative to sunset and they have done the job. Occasionally use the app to remotely control lights and that has worked too.
Would be nice to see some "advanced" control such as "if light is already on don't change it, otherwise set it to 50%". Right now you can just set it to 50% regardless of its current state.
I guess I'm nitpicking here, as the basics all work just fine.

title: Good App, Delete and Reinstall Helps
text: I have the latest iOS and updated the Lutron app. But I've had trouble getting the scenes to load. With this latest version I couldn't get them to load at all. But uninstalling and reinstalling solved it. I had to log in again and reset to my darker theme but everything else was there. Now I'm much more pleased. It's a great app in my opinion. The only thing I wish it had was a way to set my own hours and light intensity for the Smart Away schedule. But everything else is great. Amazing technology. Really easy to use.

title: Unexpected good app
text: I've always had good luck with Lutron products, and the Caseta line is no exception.  The SmartBridge was really the first time I used any sort of home automation gadget, and honestly for a company that focuses on hardware products, this application is surprisingly well done.  I've yet to encounter any sort of bug, so set up of the system was pretty easy.  Personally the only thing I would change is the color scheme they use to indicate if status:  on=light blue, off=gray.  It looks nice but for me under certain conditions it's a bit difficult to distinguish the state.

title: I thought it worked great
text:
I downloaded this app to go along with my Caseta switch and Internet bridge, I had no problems with the initial set up and everything worked well. My only reason for not giving it 5 stars is I feel the timed on/off feature should of been a little easier to figure out, but not a big problem since I emailed customer support and received an answer to my question in less than 24 hours. (You need to create a scene and then you can give it a schedule)

Thanks Brian from Lutron tech support.

title: Superb App
text: From my experience, the latest update has fixed the before mentioned bugs. Love this system, specifically I like that the dimmers use their own frequency to communicate (rather than clog the wifi) but still show up in HomeKit as separate controllable devices. I'd like to see HomeKit scenes added to the app (right now they are Lutron specific) but that isn't a deal breaker for me. Keep up the good work Lutron team!

title: Elementary App
text: The app functions, but it stops there.  There are so many ways it could be better - starting with the ability to group devices by room and to be able to see more than just 4 devices on the home screen.  Look at some of your competition, they are so much better.  I just wish I could use those apps with the Caseta devices. Lastly, there needs to be an iPad version.  Using the iPhone version on my iPad with Retina results in seeing even less devices on the screen than what I see on my iPhone. Please create an iPad version!

title: Stellar
text: I made sure to get the Smart Hub Pro version 2 with my set up. Every single wall switch and remote set up flawlessly. As always, just make sure you have a solid wifi network at home. Don't set up Picos until you are done with all of your wired devices or you have to do it again. Otherwise, great control with options like IF for customization. Love it.

title: Needs an on/off schedule.
text: These light switches and outlets have been great for us. What would make the app when better would be the ability to turn the lights off on a schedule. I like to turn the lights on for my dog but forget to turn them off at times. We used to use a timer for that but have upgraded to your app instead. Would love to see this in the next update!!

title: Great app. Feature and hardware request.
text: Overall the app works exactly as described. I use the caseta switches for my home theatre setup with my logitech whole home remote and it works eveytime. I also use it for my garage, hallway, and porch. Plan on adding more switches soon. I would really like to see a native ipad app. I would also like to see some new hardware including an outlet that is not a plugin and more availability of the non dimming switches/pico remotes.

title: Love app and functionality. Hate that Siri and HomeKit randomly stop.
text: Love the app and Caseta functionality. Over 20 devices in a newly remodeled home. Hate that the system has lost Siri/HomeKit associations more than once in the 6 weeks we've been using it. The App works; Siri stops randomly, for good. All other HomeKit devices continue to work with Siri (Philips Hue, August Lock, Ecobee3). It's frustrating and requires a good deal of troubleshooting with Lutron support and work to get it re-setup, re-associated and running with Siri again. Wish they could solve this.

text: The app is free and it works flawlessly. I guess people feel that your dimmers should say "welcome home honey would you like a drink?" Well lets talk about the app and the product. My dimmers paired instantly, my phone controls them and everything works. Just buy it and don't listen to mr 2 stars bc it didn't make me coffee. This just works.

I have other apps like my Honeywell thermostats and my LiftMaster garage doors that let me toggle between 2 properties. Lutron you need to bring the app up to 2016 standards

title: Excellent switches and app
text:
Has been a fantastic way for me to automate lights in my vacation home and keep track of things whether when at home or from afar.

Look forward to seeing more integration with addition home automation devices besides just thermostats.

Have also used wink app with caseta switches but think I prefer the Lutron app.

title: Awesome Automation
text: I love this app. The system was affordable and easy to set up - so easy I even got my friends and family systems for the holidays! I love that I can control my lights, shades, and even Nest thermostat from anywhere in the world! When I travel, I turn the lights in the living room on and off just to mess with my family!

title: Great system
text: Great system. Only thing I'd like to see updated is within the App under settings to have the ability to change locations. ADT has that ability. Since I only have one email address which is used to login to the app, I'm required to use other people's emails in order to set up other homes that I own.

text:
Amazing update all these features you added specially geo fencing is just great! Only thing I can ask for now is a sleep timer. Where we can set our bedroom light to turn off after whatever minutes a user wants. That would be a really neat feature if you can add that.

Now the reason this app is 3 star is because this app is still not optimized for iPad air why????

text: Lutron really needs to decide if they want to be in this to win it! I am a dealer for Lutron and sale both caseta and RA products. Not sure if the update has something to do with the app crashing lately  but this is an ongoing issue and I have been working with tech support every month in regards to my client systems having the same issue. It appears the app is crashing with the new update and I'm sure Lutron was given enough time by Apple to release a new version. If I turn off notifications app is okay and opens.

text:
Functionality works well overall, however if using Siri Integration you cannot name your switches the same as your Siri 'Rooms'. This is ridiculous because I've had to use abbreviations on the switches that appear on the home screen:

Living Room = LR
Kitchen = K
Etc...

Just so I can tell Siri to 'turn on the Living Room lights.'

This needs to be addressed because it will become extremely confusing with 10+ switches installed. These should be able to be named the same.

Moving to 1 star: in the most recent update the app randomly turns on lights when it thinks you are home...the update documentation literally states "randomly turns on lights when the app thinks you're home." I woke up at 3 am this morning with my lights blazing thinking someone was in my house. I love alone.

text: This feature stopped working since  the last two updates, I tried everything, uninstalled app and installed again and still  doesn't work. This is the only flaw I see with the app, I have 5 caseta dimmers and still thinking in continue upgrading around my home.

title: Super reliable and fast
text:
Really works very well as what it does, more reliable and much faster responding than my hue bulbs. For the one one-star review here, you just have to create the "off" state as a scene itself. My wishlist:

- iPad optimized UI
- An external plugin switch for three prong devices (fans, etc)
- HomeKit support

title: Functional, GUI not great.
text:
Compared to other smart home apps, this one works.  Smoothly adds devices, controls, and I appreciate the widget and apple watch app.

The GUI, for purposes of opening the app and controlling devices is just, bad.  Needs a room layout or something other than the cluttered slider look that it currently has.

title: Decent start, but major features lacking
text: It seems to work well so far, but there are several missing  or incomplete features badly needed. First, we need a native iPad app. Second, scheduled scenes need to be much more robust, allowing a real, infinitely varying schedule with variables and sunrise/sunset. Finally, there just need to be more things in the Caseta ecosystem and a higher device count. Also, initial configuration of the bridge seemed overly complex  and time consuming.

title: Solid!
text: Apple Watch : With the limited access apple initially gave developers, Lutron has done and outstanding job coding this app. Its the quickest, most stable 3rd party app that controls the home.   Lutron continues to make solid products.  I can control my Lutron Serena shades through the apple watch.

title: Bad Scheduling App
text: Easy setup. Great manual operation.  Scheduling is terrible. Need to setup separate events for on and off. No vacation schedule and randomized on/off - which why I bought this for when we are traveling.  Phillips is much better app for this. Lutron provides better dimmer switch solution and does not require smart bulbs. Will be switching back to Phillips - too bad.

title: All broken now - do not upgrade!!
text: Loved the app, last upgrade broke everything for me.  It all worked very well.  Lights will go on and off on schedule, Siri integration worked, scenes worked.   After last upgrade, the app 'forgot me' and can't seem to find a way to recover my account.   Had to create a new account and it even let me use the same credentials!!  Which means anybody that comes to my house can take over my light control.  Not very secure - scary.

title: Good app but....
text: I love the actual caseta dimmer switches and the smart bridge but the app leaves a bit to be desired. It loads slow but it's not too bad. It would be nice if you could customize the order of scenes, devices, etc... Also, it would be really awesome if Lutron created an iPad app, I think we've waited long enough.

title: Painful to get through the bugs and crashes
text: Nothing like getting a message stating simply "Error" and enduring multiple "Request Timeouts" (even when 1 ft from my router with 50 MBs speeds) when there could be no reason for it. I loved Lutron when I was using the standalone remotes, and now this thing has created needless frustration. Wish they spent some more time on debugging before throwing this out there.

title: Responsive app, great support
text: After some initial setup issues (due to some bad upgrade and some bad design decisions), Lutron support was quick to suggest a work-around and fixed the issue in a couple of days. I’m quite happy with the app, and everything works as it should.

title: Nice and simple!!
text: This app works perfect with my Lutron Caseta Smart Bridge and Caseta Wireless dimmers. Not a single glitch since first day. It's very simple and intuitive and give you full control over your lights. In the last update they added support for Nest thermostats as well!!!

text: The time it takes for this app to load you can buy a car, drive home, turn off the light, and drive back to work.  They  really should have thought about how long it takes to flip a switch when they made this app.  The only hope is to create "scenes" and make them accessible via "Today Widget" which you can access instantly.

title: Great product
text:
I've used it for about a month now. It hasn't ever not worked.  And when not using the app, the switches themselves are as nice as I've found. 

Too bad they don't own Nest.

text: When it works, it's fantastic. It crashes, it's sometimes works, and sometimes takes the night off. title: Not great but HomeKit integration works well
text:
This app does what it is supposed to but it comes with poor documentation and ugly interface. However it is integrated with Apple's built in HomeKit. What that means is that once you add your Lutron devices with the Lutron app you can use Apple's "Home" app to control your Lutron Caseta devices, create scenes, and invite other members of your household so they can also use the Home app to control your home's lights, etc. You never have to use the Lutron app once your home is setup.
Tips-
*When setting up the Lutron app it will ask you to setup an account and password. You will also get a warning that only one account can be used. Don't worry, this is merely an administrator account -it can be any valid email address and password specific for your Lutron controller. Only you need to know the details. You will still be able to invite other users with iCloud accounts to control your Lutron switches, etc.
*Use the Lutron app to add devices etc.
*Launch Apple's Home app (you might need iOS 10) and you should see your Lutron devices. You can also create scenes to control groups of lights and/or outlets. To dim lights tap and hold the switch until a slider pops up.
*Invite other members of your home to control your devices by tapping the triangle/compass icon in the top left of Home's home screen. 
*When an invited user launches the Home app on their iOS device they will see the invite. Once accepted they will be also be able to control your homes Lutron devices. There is no need for them to use -or even download- the Lutron app.

2. Why there is no admin system in the smart bridge

4. Why the 24x7 support isn't as advertised

==================

In order to even use the smart bridge you need the app.

Here’s the kicker, when you first plug in the smart bridge and use the app it tries to do a firmware upgrade which is needed in order to use HomeKit (yes they shipped it with old firmware despite the HomeKit label printed, not a sticker mind you, on the box)

I call customer support which is 24/7 and get a guy called Zach who tells me that it needs to be able to access outbound ports and that some ISP’s block these. Here’s the email:
"Often cable modem/router combination products that are sold by ATT U-verse, Verizon, Comcast, COX, and some other internet providers are locked down more than a standard cable modem would be. I would contact your Internet Service Provider (ISP) and ensure the following ports are open: 7443, 4443, 443, 8883, 1883, 123, and 22.”

I assume these are outbound ports as nobody in their right mind would allow these all open inbound to their network. Anyway, as I have a business connection I know none of these ports are blocked, but to humor them I created static routes for inbound, which didn’t work, then let the “Smart Bridge” be in the DMZ (which there is no way I’m going to do permanently)… Nothing worked.

I then called back 24/7 support to find that it’s not 24/7 at all for the Caseta products (despite the Caseta site stating it is).

Finally a guy on the forum came up with a way to get the app working. however. Great I can control my device now with the iPhone.

Then I try to integrate with Siri through the app. Guess what, it requires the firmware be updated. And that reset all my devices (yes, it’s that dumb) and I’m back to square one with nothing working.

This is the worst network product I’ve ever bought. Utter rubbish
